statement.p: Jon is conducting market research on the cost of a cruise vacation. Jon has determined that the average cost of a cruise vacation is 2500, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 338.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends more than 1970 on a cruise vacation.
b. The cost of the middle 60 of cruise vacations falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 13 of cruise vacations cost at least how much? (round to the nearest dollar)
